citations.narrative:
On April 13, 2023, a wild black bear was able to get into the primary enclosure of the whitetail deer and kill the female
deer. Although it has not been determined how the bear was able to enter the enclosure and despite the fact that the
Nature Center has an 8 foot perimeter fence encircling the property, it was not effective in preventing access by the wild
bear. A perimeter fence of at least 8 feet is required for potentially dangerous animals. The fence must be constructed so
that it protects the animals in the facility by restricting animals and unauthorized persons from going through it or under it
and having contact with the animals in the facility. Correct by June 15, 2023.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with the Animal Curator.
